fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38188].
  {panel}

This is part of getting Library add-ons ready for Data Center

Please make sure your teams set some time to update their library add-on's atlassian-plugin.xml file with DC=true. If the bit is not set, the customer can still install the add-on, it just won't have a "DC" tag on the listing display.
The format is as follows:
<param name="atlassian-data-center-compatible">true</param>
We're doing this in the plugin XML (instead of a checkbox on MPAC) for a few reasons:
* It's a better signal that the vendor has actually made code changes to support DC
* It's less error prone if the vendor has to maintain a separate DC-compatible artifact
* It lets us show DC compatibility in the UPM without reaching out to MPAC
Ruth Buchanan is already making the necessary updates to the DC compliance guidelines on DAC for both JIRA and Confluence. We also need any Atlassian plugins that are DC compliant to add the parameter to their plugin descriptor files. 
This is a one-line change that needs to be added to the first DC-compatible release of each plugin.
fields.summary: Systems/library plugin owners to mark DC bit
Update the "pricing update" form
Systems/library plugin owners to mark DC bit
Create one source of truth for DC best practice in DAC/Marketplace
Remind vendors up date their listings
Create instructions for listing a DC version
Data Center T&C or Info Page
Notify Vendors of DC coming (April)
Add a warn message when removing a group if the group is used on any workflows

fields.description:
I have a Custom Field called "Code Reviewed By". It is a mandatory field in a workflow step in our system that pulls from the JIRA client list.

It works fine, is shared in the workflow of all projects, but when I attempt to Search by this custom Field, it does not allow me - it shows the italicized, grayed out text 'Code Reviewed By' with an exclamation point icon, but no context of why this isn't a valid selection.

I've searched online for a solution, first question that came up was that the search had to be restricted to projects that supported the field in the associated workflow. I've confirmed that this is the case, yet it still doesn't work. 

Help please.
fields.summary: Unable to Search by Custom Field "Code Reviewed By"

fields.description:
*How to reproduce:*
1. Create a project or take any existing
2. Visit project's overview page and click through Reports > Time tracking report
3. On the configuration page you land on, click "Cancel".

*Expected behavior:*
You get taken back to the previous page.

*Actual behavior:*
404 skull / "Oops, you've found a dead link."

*Notes:*
Also happens when you initially configure the report, click "Next" to view it, then click the "Configure" button on the report page to get back to the configuration page and _then_ click cancel.
Also haven't tried this for the other report types that are available, so you might want to check if that problem exists there too.

fields.description:
If I export a filter to Excel or to Word the resulting download has an .xls or a .doc file extension, but in both cases the file contains HTML. Have I misconfigured something (content types?), or is the "Export Excel/Doc" function mistakenly hooked up to "Export HTML" instead?

I just want to export the contents of the filter. CSV would be fine too (and more portable).

Steps to repro:
1. From the Issues > Search For Issues page, obtain a list of issues.
2. Choose Export > Word or Export > Excel.
3. A file "Atlassian JIRA.xls" or "Atlassian JIRA.doc" will be downloaded.
4. The file will open in Pages or Numbers but will only show the raw HTML.
5. From terminal run "file Atlassian\ JIRA.xls" and observe that it reports "HTML Document Text".
6. Rename the file to "Atlassian JIRA.html" and open it in a browser.
7. Observe that it renders as a web page.

Expected behaviour: file should be in Excel or Word format.

(Jira 6.3 EAP, Chrome, OS X.)
fields.summary: Export to Excel or Word Is Generating HTML Instead

fields.description:
Hey guys,

Just started using JIRA and Fisheye, and I'm seeing this issue on both. We use a novell, and decided to use LDAP in order to allow users to login using their credentials. But, we've been running across issues. I've logged in several times with my credentials and somehow logged in with someone else's account. Although, I still have administration rights and it doesn't seem to move it to the users I log into. Another user who is also an admin is having the same issue herself, in which she logs in with my ID somehow. Also, we have testrail and integrated JIRA. When we push a ticket to our JIRA site, it'll have the issue come up then so sometimes it'll post the ticket with different user IDs than what it's supposed to be doing. 

I've tried re-adding the LDAP settings to make sure I'm doing it right, but this issue has become a daily issue.

We are using JIRA v6.2.2 and SuSE Enterprise Server 11 SP2 (using VMWare)

Please assist! Thanks!

  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Create a user
# Create an issue and assign it to the user created
# Navigate to _Administration > User Namangement_ and change the username for the user
# Go back to the issue created, and reassign it to another user and then assign it to the same user created earlier 

*Expected Results*:
The Issue *History* tab will show the new username of the user

*Actual Results*:
The issue *History* tab shows the old username before the rename of the user. Even though the full name is changed as expected, however the username is no changed.
fields.summary: Old username still shows in issue history after renameing a user.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38162].
  {panel}

When a user wants to add a field to their Filter Results gadget, they need to do the following:

# Click "Edit" in the gadget's config menu.
# Pick the field from the drop-down.
# Click "Add".
# Click "Save".

At least 5 times in the past week I've accidentally skipped step 3 and then wondered why the field wasn't added.

I was the person who originally wrote this UI and it seems it isn't even intuitive to me :(

The reason the "add" button was included in the first place (rather than adding the field automatically when an item is selected) was to make the feature keyboard-navigable in all browsers.

I think the best solution is, if you click "Save" and there's a field selected in the dropdown but not added yet; either:
* Prompt the user with a dirty form warning, or
* Automatically add the field.

!FilterResultsAdd.png!
fields.summary: It's too easy to mess up adding a field / column to the Filter Results gadget

fields.description:
It'd be nice to remove the legacy screenshot applet before 6.3 is cut. 

When this happens we also need to remove the code from the newer screenshot plugin that enables the legacy applet when the newer plugin is uninstalled, since this code will no longer make sense.

h4. Testing notes
# CI plans are deleted.
# Ensure nothing is using the these property keys: (including documentation)
## {{jira.screenshotapplet.enabled}}
*** ✔︎ not in jira
*** ✔︎ not in jira-html5-attach-images
*** ✔︎ referenced in https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=296092170, notified [~wthompson] that the page should be removed

fields.summary: remove the legacy screenshot applet from source

fields.description:
When updating the screenshot applet the changes do not always take effect until the java cache is cleared, meaning that the applet is not properly sanitising the cache.

The reason this happens is due to URL used to reference applet JAR:

{code}
var attributes = {
    id: 'JIRA HTML5 Images Applet',
    codebase: AJS.Meta.get("context-path") + "/download/resources/com.atlassian.plugins.jira-html5-attach-images:jira-html5-attach-images-resources/",
    code: "com.atlassian.plugins.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreenshotApplet.class",
    archive: "applet/screenshot.jar",
    width: 0,
    height: 0
};
{code}

Note how the cache busting portion ({{/s/.../_/}}) is missing — it should appear between the context path and {{/download/}}. The cache busting portion isn't web resource manager (WRM) API, so there's no JavaScript way to retrieve a suitable value for that.

One approach to implementing this is to use {{webResourceUrlProvider.getStaticPluginResourceUrl}} in conjunction with the new {{WRM.data}} API to transfer the URL from backend to frontend.

h3. Testing notes

# Ensure the HTTP response for {{screenshot.jar}} has the {{cache-control: max-age}} header.
# Ensure [~bayers] is on the pull request.
# Ensure {{deployJava.js}} and {{deployJava.html}} also have appropriate caching.
# Avoid introducing any new JARs for JSON serialisation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38156].
  {panel}

At the moment, it's not possible to select a subset of issues from the search, and then perform a bulk operation on those issues. A user must adjust their JQL search and then run the bulk update on the results, similar to how this is done in the Gmail interface.
 
For Example:
There is a filter which is a list of issues created over the last 3 days, from the summary the User can then select similar issues and assign them to a single person directly.

Similarly, you can in this way bulk close, assign or apply labels to these issues. This is extremely helpful for any workflow where a daily triage is necessary.

When pages from a linked Confluence site (added using Application Links) are added as "Issue Links" to JIRA, if the page link contains a link to a section in the page as a HTML anchor (for example, http://confluence:8080/display/myspace/Page#Page-Section), then the anchors should also be displayed.

*Notes*
* It is possible to add links using anchors using the REST remote API interface.
* Links to other sites as well as unauthenticated Confluence links show anchors, so it seems to be restriction for authenticated Confluence links

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Open Create Issue dialog
# Enter some text into description
# Press escape (dirty form warning should display)
# Change issue type
# Press escape

*Expected outcome:*
Dirty form warning displays

*Actual outcome:*
No dirty form warning is displayed and changes are lost

h5. Testing notes
Details of Test Heuristics can be found at http://go/stopsu 

*Stress*
* Holding Escape key down shouldn't dismiss the dialog under any circumstances (assuming the form is dirty)

*Time* 
* Press Escape key immediately after pressing another key (changing the form from clean to dirty)

*Operations* 
* N/A

*Platform* 
* jira-quick-edit should have different versions for JIRA 6.3, 6.4 and 7.0
* Browsers: IE 9-11, Firefox, Chrome, and Safari

*Security* 
* N/A

*Usability* 
* Confirmation dialog should never appear if the form is clean
* Confirmation dialog should not appear if the form returns to a clean state

*Other*
* Should also work for Quick Edit Issue dialog. Initially the form should be rendered as clean
fields.summary: When creating an issue, when I have entered content and I press escape, a dirty form warning should always display

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38150].
  {panel}

I wrote up ticket
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37971

And was then told basically that I should go file the bug again in another system for support.

Which I did by making https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jsp/configuration-query-192037

This is not a user friendly approach
1) It assumes the user has perfect pre-existing ability to determine what kind of issue should belong in what kind of system
2) It requires the user spending time to report the same issue twice.

There should be some way for JIRA themselves to "move" a ticket like https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jsp/configuration-query-192037 into the support systems themselves. Enable that process for the end user don't make the end user jump through more hoops because the complexity of the system itself by which users deliver feedback is multifarious and confusing.
fields.summary: Some feature where JIRA admins can "move" tickets created in JIRA to support structure

fields.description:
If you change the application password in Crowd, then when you go to edit this password in JIRA, you are forced to click "Test Settings" before you can "Save and Test". After clicking "Test Settings", the value of the password is then reset in the form to the previous value, so if you immediately click "Save and Test" after "Test Settings", the same password will be saved again.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up an application in Crowd
# Connect JIRA to that application and check it's synchronising successfully
# Change the application password for that application in Crowd
# Disable and re-enable the directory in JIRA to immediately invalidate the session to Crowd
# Force a sync and watch it fail
# Edit the directory
# Enter the new password and click "Test Settings"
# After the test succeeds, click "Save and Test"
# Observe that the sync still fails
# Observe that the password value stored in cwd_directory_attribute table is still holding the old password

h4. Expected Results

The value should be held after clicking "Test Settings", so that then clicking "Save and Test" will work correctly.

h4. Actual Results

The value is lost, so the new password doesn't get saved

h4. Workaround

After clicking "Test Settings", enter the new password again into the form before clicking "Save and Test"

h4. Workaround for Delegated LDAP Connector
(!) Do not click the 'Test Settings' button
- Open console in the browsers developer tools and run the following commands
{code}
AJS.$('#configure-delegating-ldap-form-submit').removeAttr("aria-disabled");
AJS.$('#configure-delegating-ldap-form-submit').removeAttr("disabled");
{code}
- That will allow you to click the 'Save and Test' button, with first clicking 'Test Settings'
fields.summary: When editing an existing Crowd directory to change the application password, the application password value is reset to the old value after clicking "Test Settings"

fields.description:
UserMatcherPredicate is used to search for users by a combination of :
* user name
* email address and
* display name.
It does all matching in a case insensitive way.

The way it does this is far less well performing that it could be.  This has a high impact when the number of users to be searched is very large.

*Important Fix Versions Note*
* This is fixed in JIRA 6.1.8 and in 6.2.6+
** 6.2 through 6.2.5 *does not* include this fix
fields.summary: UserMatcherPredicate matches users using lowercase in a poorly performing manner

fields.description:
When building sets of users, OfBizUser repeatedly caclulates its hashcode. To be correct and compatible with the {{equals}} impementation, it needs to convert the user name to lower case in a locale sensitive way, which is expensive.

As the OfBbizUser object is immutable this value can be retained once caclultated.
fields.summary: OfBizUser should cache its hashcode to improve performance in large instances

  {panel}

Dear Atlassian,

When I select a filter to display on our wiki page on confluence it will pop-up automatically with the help of the Jira Macro. In the display options there is the "Attachment"  column. 

It will be nice if the Attachments from the Drag and drop plug-in of Jira will show as a link or something in confluence with the use of the Macro. But when i select the column I don't see anything. If there is a attachment inside a jira issue which is inside the filter, the attachment field stays blank.

It's strange that the drag and drop system in Jira makes the file list under the heading " AttachmentS ", while in Confluence the column name is " Attachment ".

How can i solve this problem?

Friendly Regards,

Total Company

I'm trying to configure a JIRA plug-in called Behaviors to calculate a field by using data from two other fields. So far I've had no luck with the configuration or online help.

I am unable to figure out the exact issue here. Somehow, our script is unable to read the “formField” object. This object is supposed to be activated with Behaviors plugin as it (formField object) is not available with JIRA’s default classes:
 
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/jira/6.0.5/reference/classes.html

Would it be possible to get more guidance here?

Thanks

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. In Inquiry workflow, try to Add Transition ("Reopen") from Closed to Open state.
2. The Add Transition link is not available in the Inquiry Workflow, Text screen (See attached Cannot Add Transition from Closed to Open 1.png)
3. Go to Inquiry Workflow, Diagram screen and press Add Transition.  This fails with error "You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow" (See attached Cannot Add Transition from Closed to Open 2.png)

JIRA should allow adding transitions out of the Closed state.  This worked last year and is a recently introduced bug.

The same bug was mentioned in the comments forum on this page on March 26, 2014: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-Limitationswheneditinganactiveworkflow
fields.summary: Cannot Add Transition from Closed to Open

h4. Expected Behaviour:
The permission checking should involve the project that browse by user but not all the projects configured with such security level.


h4. Actual Behaviour/How many SQL Queries could be fired in just one Browse Project action:
* Each Current Assignee in Security Level fired one SQL SELECT query.
* So 1 issue security scheme with average 3 security levels using *Current Assignee* will generate 3 queries *for each associated projects with the schemes.*
* So if JIRA has 5 security schemes with following setup, it would generate *15 queries(5 * 3*).
* So if customer has 200 projects attached to such issue security schemes, it means that it would generate *3000 SQL Queries(200 x 15)* in just one action!

h4. Notes: 
* This happens when you browse *ANY* project and these queries will fired to check the permission. For example, if a user browse a project *WITHOUT* associated to such issue security scheme, this SQL queries will still continue to fire to the database.
* This can generate performance impact as there is JIRA instance experienced a maximum of 18 million such queries executed in the database due to high number of projects(eg. 200 projects) configured with issue security scheme. This could potentially overloaded the database server with 3 CPUs of 100% performance especially there are concurrent usage by the users.
* It seems generated as well when picking project one by one from issue navigator and accessing issue from issue navigator.
fields.summary: Current Assignee in Issue Security Level fired high numbers of SQL queries of different project to database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38136].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a JIRA Instance has many Security Levels the performance of JIRA can degrade significantly.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an environment with many Projects and Issue Security Configuration.
# Observe a degradation of performance on the instance.
# Thread dumps from an affected JIRA instance may indicate many threads showing a stack traces involving IssueSecurity.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should remain performant and cope with the scale in issues or issue security.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA becomes unresponsive with large numbers of issue security levels configured.

h3. Notes
[Configuring Issue level Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security] currently indicates thar setting more than 10 issue security levels can impact performance in JIRA.

h3. Workaround
# Run the following SQL to check the number of security level:
{code}
select scheme, count(security) from schemeissuesecurities group by scheme;
scheme | count
--------+-------
  10000 |  1279
  10030 |    3
  ...
(7 rows){code}
# Reduce the issue security levels. 
# Reduce the number of groups using in each level.
fields.summary: JIRA performance degrades when a large number of security levels are used

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38125].
  {panel}

One common total crash for JIRA is when it does run out of database connection. 

Any reliable web application should be able to resist to a peak in number of request and not to fully crash when this happens. 

This is also a security issue because it means that anyone could easily bring the server down just by issuing requests to it.

The correct behavior is to stop processing new requests when this happens and to respond with HTTP 503, also logging an ERROR.
fields.summary: prevent crashing when running out of database connections

fields.description:
We are upgrading a JIRA 5.2.7 instance to version 6.2.3.  The 64-bit installer completed without error, but one warning regarding manual changes to the server.xml file.  No SQL server connection information is in the server.xml file.

After restarting JIRA the following error was displayed when accessing JIRA from a browser:

JIRA Startup Failed
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT pluginkey, pluginenabled FROM jira.pluginstate (Invalid object name 'jira.pluginstate'.) 

The back end database is SQL Server 2012,  JIRA is running on a Windows 2008 R2 server.  

On checking the JIRA database on the server I can confirm that there is no jira.pluginstate table.  There is a jira.pluginversion table, but it does not have a pluginenabled column.
fields.summary: JIRA Startup Failed - Invalid object name 'jira.pluginstate'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38117].
  {panel}

We have a JIRA workflow with the following:
- Upon creation, tickets enter the "Triage" state.
- There is a transition called "Assign" that transitions it to the "Assigned" state.
- This "Assign" transition is tied to a custom screen where the Assignee, Priority, etc can be set.

Due to the built in "Assign" button and "Assign to Me" link, it is possible for developers to use these to assign issues to others or themselves without actually setting priority and transitioning the issue to the Assigned state. If they notice this, they can then use the correct "Assign" button (for our workflow transition) to advance state and set priority, however this results in two emails being sent to the Reporter for the same action. If they don't notice this, the issue is in the wrong state and may be lost (for example, if a user has a filter set up to show issues in the "Assigned" state and the "Assignee" is them, it will not show these tickets because the ticket is still in the "Triage" state).

I would like to propose the ability to remove the Assign button and related items like the "Assign to Me" link. This is not currently possible in JIRA OnDemand. Our instance lists version "6.3-OD-03-012".

*Workaround*
The links and buttons can be hidden via CSS. Refer to https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=665421833
fields.summary: Ability to remove "Assign" button from issue header bar and "Assign to Me" links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38109].
  {panel}

I have experienced that it is sometimes quite troublesome to prioritise issues. Different people find their own issues more important than others and claim priority over others. How can I 'score' my issues objectively?

I would really like a calculator to compute business value based upon a number of questions like "Are there many users/customers involved?". Yes? then add 100 points, No? No points.
"Does my company suffer financial damage?" Yes? 250 points, No? No points
"Is it easy to fix?" Yes? 50 points, No? No points
"Is the issue law- or policy based?" Yes? 150 points, No? No points etc. etc.

The sum of all these criteria result in my business value. Of course I can always add a (less objective score) number of points if my managers really want an issue ranked higher on the list...

I currently use an Excel sheet to do this for me, but it would be nice if I could manage the criteria and the scores in each seperate project. Then (adding a new issue) I call up the calculator, answer the yes/no questions and click [adopt business value to issue].

I hope more users like this idea.

Kind regards!
fields.summary: Business Value 'Calculator'

fields.description:
There are some ambiguities in the CustomFieldType interface that make correct implementation problematic. 

For example, the createValue() method is documented in the interface as a method to "Save the value for this Custom Field in a particular issue to the database", and none of the parameters to the method are annotated with @Nonnull. 

However, in the abstract implementation AbstractSingleFieldType, createValue() has the documentation "at this point we know that the value doesn't exist, and that <value> is not null", and although the <value> parameter is not annotated with @Nonnull, the docs suggest that it shouldn't ever be null. 

It is unclear whether <value> being null is prohibited at the interface level, or just for this abstract class, and there are other examples of this is the CustomFieldType interface. It would be better if parameters to methods in the CustomFieldType interface were appropriately annotated if they should never be null.
fields.summary: Contract for the CustomFieldType interface needs improvement

fields.description:
{panel}
h3. Problem
When users are greeted by the error 500 page, they can click on the {{Request assistance}} link to expand and see the long stack trace of the error that occurs. The information is not useful to most of the end users but it's not possible to hide it from them.

h3. Suggestion
To have an option to hide any technical information about an error to users or feature to set a generic error page to users.

(flag) In some cases, no error is visible in the GUI but still can be captured by the browser's F12 tools. The bug fix should take this into account as well.

h3. Remarks
The stack trace *does not* contain sensitive information about the application that cannot be gathered from the product's source code, which is available to any paying customer. 
{panel}

{panel:title=Original description}
When an error condition is triggered by a user or black-box security scanner such as Acunetix, the system provides an appropriate error page.  However, the error page includes the stack trace which the scanner will determine to be a potential Information Disclosure vulnerability because the stack trace may include information that can be used by an attacker to refine their attack or information gathering efforts.

Reproduction (one example) can be performed using the following steps:

1.) As a user, log in to Jira and nagivate to /charts by changing the url to https://<yourjiradomain>/charts

2.) Click the "Request Assistance" link to view the stack trace

This is an example request sent to Jira from Acunetix which produced the problem:

GET /charts HTTP/1.1
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Cookie: JSESSIONID=9682349A6ADB9BDC7F9923C26E05C9BE;
atlassian.xsrf.token=B50V-89VK-EG1H-RFHM|670c916d8653f5135e09afda57b558400b095218|lin
Host: jira-test.ksc.nasa.gov
Connection: Keep-alive
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko)
Chrome/28.0.1500.63 Safari/537.36
Acunetix-Product: WVS/9.0 (Acunetix Web Vulnerability Scanner - NORMAL)
Acunetix-Scanning-agreement: Third Party Scanning PROHIBITED
Acunetix-User-agreement: http://www.acunetix.com/wvs/disc.htm
Accept: */*
{panel}
fields.summary: Jira outputs a stack trace to the screen when an error is encountered

fields.description:
like CONF-23957 - if you use the sso connector to crowd the users credentials are NOT copied to local cache in JIRA.
The user is created in crowd from delegated ldap but not copied to local cache.
The result is that the user sees: "username or password are incorrect" since the user is synced to local cache.

This behaviour is different from the "normal" authenticator that indeed copies the credentials.
fields.summary: JIRA SSO authenticator class does not copy users on login
Invalid link on JIRA documentation page

fields.description:
When you enter the URL of a private JIRA instance on the Quick Search from the login page, you will be directed to the Issue Navigator.
!mark_2.jpg|thumbnail!

If you click the "Status" drop down button, you the unauthenticated user would be able to see the status codes. 
!mark_1.jpg|thumbnail!

If you click "Find filters" you would be able to see the names of filters, wherein the visibility was set to "All users".

This is really critical for all users, especially those information are confidential and shouldn't be visible to unauthenticated users.
fields.summary: Unauthenticated User can access certain pages on a private JIRA instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The JIRA mail queue can stop processing after an OutOfMemoryError.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup JIRA to send mail.
# Cause it to throw an OOME.

h3. Expected Results

Mail will continue to send.

h3. Actual Results

Mail stops sending.

h3. Notes

This is described in further detail in [Mail Queue Must Be Flushed Manually due to OutOfMemoryError|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Mail+Queue+Must+Be+Flushed+Manually+due+to+OutOfMemoryError] - the fix is to increase the memory. It would be better if JIRA could handle this itself.
fields.summary: Mail Queue stops processing due to OutOfMemoryError
Rendering of bullet points has different indentation during Preview of a wiki-renderable field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38090].
  {panel}

Apparently, if you have HTML configured as default notification, and you're going to use the send mail functionality to send a notification to your users, and specify the notification to be "Text", the mail will be sent as text, but will keep all the HTML tags from the default configuration.
This is not the expected behavior indeed, the notification should be sent as text and not leaving the html tags.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Configure the Outgoing mail.
# Browse to Administration >> User Management >> Change the default Notifications to "HTML"
# Browse to System >> Send mail.
# Send an email to a Group/role, and send as "Text"
# The email will be sent showing the HTML tags of the default notification.

h3. Expected Behavior:

The notification should be converted to plain text, removing the HTML tags.
fields.summary: Send email as text shows the HTML tags.

fields.description:
h3.Symptoms
* After restoring JIRA from backup, inline editing does not work.
* The 'issue' view page shows the 'Views' menu instead of 'Actions' menu. (See attachment 'Symptom.png')
* On editing the field, the new issue view page has inline editing enabled.

h3.Solution
In this particular case where it was observed, the problem was resolved when the original {{jira-config.properties}} file was restored to {{[$JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]}} folder.

h3.Analysis
* The reason for this behaviour in 6.1.6 is not yet known.
* The restore was tested in version 6.2.3 and the erroneous behaviour was not observed.

{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1|bgColor=#FFFFCE}
In case you observe the error, kindly post a comment with as much details as you could, because that might help find the root cause!
{panel}
fields.summary: Inline editing does not work after restore

fields.summary: Error when attempting to send test email to external address

fields.description:
Using the Assign button in a JIRA issue to change assignee will generate an email notification if the notification scheme is set to send an email at the Issue Assigned Event.

However, if you edit the assignee field on the page with the hover edit functionality, JIRA will not generate an email notification.
fields.summary: Changing assignee on page does not generate email notification

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Have an OnDemand instance with Audit Logging enabled
# Export through BackupManager
# Import to JIRA 6.2.3
# Log in, enable Audit Logging
# Click to Audit Log page
# 500 error results

{noformat}Cause
Referer URL: http://kidney.staff.sf.atlassian.com:9623/623/auditing/settings
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In template JIRA.Templates.Auditing.recordsPage: In 'print' tag, expression "$records" evaluates to undefined.
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In template JIRA.Templates.Auditing.recordsPage: In 'print' tag, expression "$records" evaluates to undefined.
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMainHelper(BaseTofu.java:341){noformat}

In addition, log entries are seen when the scheduled Audit Log Cleaning Service gets started (attached) and when the Audit Settings page is loaded:

{noformat}2014-04-29 10:40:19,325 http-bio-9623-exec-20 WARN sysadmin 640x257x1 eirztv 10.8.0.18 /auditing/settings [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.auiplugin:aui-inline-dialog{noformat}
fields.summary: Exporting from OnDemand to Behind the Firewall breaks the Audit Log feature

fields.description:
1) Create custom fields using the Multi User Picker and User Picker.
2) Navigate to the specific workflow step.
3) Navigate to Validators.
4) Add the custom fields as required field as a validator.

Upon performing the workflow action specified, the user isn't prompted to enter a user and the action completes.

The more specific example: We'd like to notify the developer once we close an issue. So I've created a "Notify" field using both Multi User Picker and User Picker and placed that as the last step of our workflow (Close Issue). On that step transition, I've set up a validator to make that field required (only during that step) but if the field is left empty, JIRA doesn't indicate the field is required. Is there a fix for this issue?
fields.summary: Unable to make the custom fields "Multi User Picker" and "User Picker" required via the validator.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38077].
  {panel}

We have recently upgraded to JIRA 6.2.3 (from JIRA 5.1) and so all our original status images have since changed to the colour lozenges.

Broadly, this is a nice change, however there are too few lozenge colours available to meet all our different states.

We desperately need the ability to set different lozenge colours across multiple projects - for instance, we run test case management through JIRA, there are two 'end' states, 'Passed' or 'Failed', at the moment these are both green which makes it harder to rapidly spot the failed ones in a list and is a definite visual regression.

Even if the lozenges were just expanded to include the Atlassian standard ones this would be a great help! :

https://developer.atlassian.com/design/latest/communicators/lozenges/
fields.summary: Ability to customize/expand status lozenges colour

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1) Create the issue in the specific project.
 2) Change the Reporter to other UserName and Stop watching the issue.
 2) Navigate to Browse Project Page--> Activity Stream
 3) The change Reporter activity is seen in Activity Stream

Expected Result:
 1) If the Vote button is clicked, the voting of the issue should be successful and the same should be displayed in View Issue screen.
 2) If the Watch button is clicked, the user should be added as watchers of issue and the same should be displayed in View Issue screen.

Actual Result:
 1) The error message is displayed as 'An unknown error occurred while voting.'
 2) The error message is displayed as 'An unknown error occurred while adding you as a watcher.'

Observation:

We are getting same issue in the Activity Stream Dashboard gadget and Activity Stream in the User Profile page.

Please find the attached document for your reference.
fields.summary: An 'Unknown error' is displayed while trying to Vote and Watch the issue from the Activity Stream in Browse Project page
